turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Scent rubbing.
turn.1: What does the Andean bear do when it scent rubs?
turn.2: The andean bear scent rubs against trees at marking sites by rubbing its neck, shoulders, flanks or back.
turn.3: What happens if it urinates on the tree?
turn.4: Sometimes this species marks the tree with its claws or urinates while rubbing.
turn.5: Why do they mark their territory with feces?
turn.6: The behaviour in this species is thought to be linked to intraspecific communication.
turn.8: The rubbing behaviours of the Southern brown howler monkeys are linked to scent marking.
turn.9: Do other animals do it too?
turn.10: Throat (facial and neck), anal, dorsal, chest and chin rubbing has been observed in "Alouatta" and is mostly performed while sitting.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Like felids, howler monkeys use their vomeronasal sensory organs to distinguish pheromones.
